title: Care Assistant (Nights)
description:
Parklands is a purpose built 54 bed Nursing Home, in South Benfleet. We offer 24 hour quality nursing care for older people and those with physical disabilities.

Parklands is situated in a quiet residential area. Shops, public transport facilities, a library and places of worship are all close by. Benfleet Rail Station is less than a mile away.

We are looking for Care Assistants to join our existing team. We are looking for Full Time and Part Time carers. Experience is preferred but not essential as full training is given.

The shift patterns could be:

-7am-7pm (12 hr shifts)

-7am-2pm (Early)

-2pm-7pm (Late)

The role requires you to work alternate weekends and some bank holidays across the year.

Job responsibilities:

-To undertake personal care needs of residents.  
-Assist residents with dressing, undressing, bathing and toileting.  
-Serve meal and assist at meal times.  
-Read and write reports in daily notes.  
-Report all accidents and complaints to staff in charge.  
-To ensure that a comfortable and clean environment is maintained in the home.

Essential Requirements:

-A desire to help others  
-Adaptable caring and open minded.  
-Good communicator ability to understand and respond to verbal/ nonverbal communications.  
-Numerate, literate, Effective team worker.

Part-time hours: 12-48 per week

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Part-time hours: 12-48 per week

Salary: From £11.44 per hour

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Pay: £11.44 per hour

* Quarterly bonus

Benefits:

* On-site parking

* Home care: 1 year (preferred)

title: Multi-Site Fridge Operator (rider)
description:
**Requirements**

* You must have access to a motorbike or scooter and your own insurance
* You must be willing to commute to multiple locations across London including; Archway, Warren Street, Tooting, Whitechapel, Ladbroke Grove and Denmark Hill
* You can start as soon as possible
* You have the right to work in the UK
* You can work at **least 8 hours a week**
* You are comfortable moving, lifting and transporting food and drink
* Your shifts will be on weekends and one shift during the week
* You are available for a weeks worth of training, these shifts may vary outside your usual working hours
* You are always on time and follow instructions exactly
* You have a Smart Phone
* You will earn £14 per hour

**Background**

We are on a mission to solve feeding NHS staff across the UK. We started as charity back in March 2020 with one simple aim - get food to frontline NHS workers. Since that first delivery, Meals For The NHS went on to raise £1.8m from the public, delivering over 300,000 meals to 147 hospitals from over 220 food providers, all powered by an awesome team of 100 volunteers.

In the last few years, we have launched Smart Fridges to provide 24/7 access to nutritious and affordable food. We are expanding the number of Smart Fridges we have available and to help us meet the demand and help us scale-up, we are now expanding our fridge operations team.

**We are searching someone who is:**

Highly reliable, task orientated, technologically comfortable, takes initiative and is comfortable with routine tasks requiring moving things around

* **Highly reliable** - will turn up to every shift, on time, time after time
* **Task orientated** - will follow specific tasks, to the letter, and complete all checklists systematically
* **Technologically comfortable** - comfortable handling new digital tools and a smart phone as part of their every day job
* **Takes initiative** - if they spot issues, have queries, or see things broken - will proactively raise them immediately
* **Comfortable moving, lifting and sticking** - their task will primarily involve moving, lifting, shifting and removing food, drinks and snacks around a hospital. They will need to be comfortable with this as their primary task

**Practically, they will need to be:**

* On Hospital Site to perform duties, including lifting and moving chilled and ambient food around the site
* Have access to a smart phone
* Be comfortable handing all types of food and drinks

Job Types: Part-time, Zero hours contract

Pay: £14.00 per hour

Expected hours: 8 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Company events
* Discounted or free food

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Every weekend
* Night shift

Application question(s):

* What is your home postcode?
* Are you OK lifting, carrying, and moving heavy boxes of food and drink?
* Have you ever worked in a supermarket or in the food service?
* Are you comfortable to use public transport or your own transportation to attend multiple locations within London?

Language:

* Do you speak English fluently? (required)

Work Location: On the road

title: General Manager
description:
### **The Why, the What and the Who...**



Are you a motivational General Manager looking for a highly autonomous role, with the power to really shape and influence the business?



Are you looking for an employer that will heavily invest in you, and provide copious opportunities to develop your career further?



Are you looking for a business that is financially stable and has very exciting growth plans?



If so, then look no further!


**The Why...**

Join Hollywood Bowl Group as a General Manager, in return you’ll get:


* Performance bonus: 15% of annual base pay, paid quarterly
* Outperformance bonus: Up to 15% of your centre’s outperformance, paid annually (Average bonus FY23 was £40,000!)
* Access to our Electric Vehicle scheme
* 50% off food when you are working
* Optional pension plan
* Earn additional days holiday with length of service up to five days
* One in four weekends off
* Ongoing training and development
* Free games vouchers every month
* 30% discount off food and drink for you and up to five friends
* Access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) for you and your family, plus access to dedicated Mental Health First Aiders
* Opportunity to join our healthcare cash plan
* Financial long service awards
* A £15 donation to our dedicated charity partner when you complete your induction
* Enhanced maternity, paternity, adoption, and shared parental leave benefits

**The What...**

As a General Manager for Hollywood Bowl Group, you will be responsible for running one of our busy centres. You will create a safe, fun, and vibrant environment for your team and customers.



You will enjoy the freedom to make a real impact driving the financial and commercial performance of your business, across all four revenue streams; the bar, diner, amusements and bowling. You will be fully accountable for delivering all areas of your budget and KPIs, driving the profit performance of your centre and have the opportunity to share in the success.



Within our fast-paced, dynamic world, General Managers coach, lead, motivate and inspire team to deliver outstanding service that delights our customers and keeps them coming back for more.


**To be successful, you should have:**


* Experience as a hands-on General Manager ideally within the leisure, hospitality, or retail industry
* Experience managing a budget size of at least £1m
* A relentless approach to delivering the best operational standards in the industry
* Evidence of optimising sales and performance of a business unit
* A passion for people, with evidence of coaching, developing, and progressing your team
* An empathetic and compassionate approach
* Resilience, flexibility, and adaptability, to fit in with our fast-paced environment
* Willingness to work nights and weekends
**The Who...**

Hollywood Bowl Group has a passion for bringing families and friends together for affordable fun and healthy competition.



Following our listing on the main stock market in 2016 we became Hollywood Bowl Group, seeking out the perfect locations for our bowling and golf centres nationwide. We formed our customer proposition, built on real feedback, and went from strength to strength with our in-centre game technology and online scoring systems.



Now with 72 centres across the UK and 12 centres in Canada, operating under the Hollywood Bowl, Puttstars and Splitsville brands, we’re proud to be ambitious market leaders in experiential family entertainment.



We continue to expand our estate and look for profitable opportunities to grow, with an average of three new sites opening each year.


*At Hollywood Bowl Group, we value diversity and inclusion, and we’re committed to creating a working environment that promotes equal opportunities. Individual differences and the contributions of all employees are recognised and valued and we b**elieve that a diverse and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company.*
company_addresses: Hollywood Bowl Group Focus 31, West Wing Cleveland Road Hemel Hempstead HP2 7BW
company_description: Bowling. Mini golf. Arcades and more. People across the UK come to us to celebrate their special days and enjoy their time off.

title: Bar Staff - Fri & Sat Night
description:
The Beach Bar, Maidstone.

We're hiring! Join one of the most vibrant bars in town during our busy Karaoke nights. We need a dynamic, fun loving individual to join our busy team.

Previous bar experience preferred. Must be available for the followng hours:

Friday: 5pm until 1am

Saturday: 5pm until 2am

There is the possibility of Sunday daytime shifts in the future too.

Great benefits including subsidised drinks and free Thai food.

Huge benefit if you love your karaoke!

...............

Job Summary:

We are seeking dedicated individuals to join our team as Bar Staff. As a member of our dynamic team, you will play a crucial role in providing exceptional customer service in a fast-paced and exciting environment. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure that our guests have an enjoyable and memorable experience while adhering to all safety and quality standards.

Duties:

- Greet customers warmly and provide excellent customer service throughout their visit  
- Prepare and serve a variety of beverages, including cocktails, beers, and non-alcoholic drinks  
- Maintain cleanliness and organization of the bar area  
- Handle cash transactions accurately and efficiently  
- Monitor and manage inventory levels to prevent shortages  
- Collaborate with the kitchen staff to ensure timely service of food orders

- Upsell drinks and promote special offers to customers

Qualifications:

- Prior experience in a hospitality or customer service role is preferred  
- Proficiency in basic math skills for handling cash transactions  
- Strong time management skills to prioritize tasks effectively in a busy environment  
- Knowledge of bartending techniques is a plus  
- Ability to work well in a team and communicate effectively with colleagues  
- Familiarity with restaurant operations and procedures

Joining our team as Bar Staff offers you the opportunity to work in a vibrant setting where you can showcase your hospitality skills while learning and growing in the industry. If you are passionate about delivering exceptional service and creating memorable experiences for customers, we invite you to apply for this exciting position.

title: Bank Support Worker at Burleys Wood
description:
**Bank Support Worker - £12.50 per hour**



Shaw healthcare are delighted to announce that we are a Real Living Wage Employer as well as the UK’s largest employee owned healthcare company. In our recognition of your contribution to the care that our service users need, we are committed to making sure your salary is significantly more than the Government National Minimum Wage. Our employees are at the centre of everything we do……



Are you a Friendly, Compassionate and Caring person who is looking for a career where you feel valued and where you are rewarded for the work that you do? If so, this could be the perfect opportunity for you. Do you enjoy seeing people get the most out of every day and achieve what they want in life? This is what a Career in Shaw healthcare is all about. We look to provide as much flexible working as possible to secure your work/life balance.



Shaw healthcare is looking for a Support Worker to join the team at Burleys Wood In Crawley. You will join a team that is fully committed to making a difference to the lives of those who we provide care for. Our aim is to deliver the highest standard of care to our service users and to provide the same standard of care that we would expect our own family members to receive. You will be using the latest care technology that will enable you to spend more time with the service users that you care for. Burleys Wood In Crawley has an excellent reputation as highly valued provider of care. The needs of our service users are at the centre of all we do every single day.



As a Support Worker you will be responsible for providing physical and emotional support to our lovely service users. Assisting service user’s with washing, dressing, and promoting independence where possible. No day is the same asides from the enormous sense of satisfaction you will feel every day knowing that you are always making a difference to someone’s life.



We will provide you with full training. This includes our leadership programme which can support your development and opportunities for progression within Shaw. Outstanding recognition schemes such as Shaw Star Awards and Long Service Awards



You don’t need to have previous experience in this field, nor do you need qualifications – we’re happy to work with you to help you become an excellent member of our team.


**Salary: £12.50 per hour**

**Working Hours:** Bank contract



days - 07:45 - 20:15



nights - 20:00 - 08:00


**APPLY TODAY! Be one of the special people that make a difference!**

title: Corporate Night Security Officer
description:
**Wilson James have been raising standards in security, construction logistics, aviation services, and technology for over 30 years. With 5,000 employees and a presence across over 300 client sites all over the UK, we are dedicated to delivering tailored solutions and top-tier customer service. As a leading managed service provider, we prioritise safety, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. Joining Wilson James offers the excitement of working with diverse, vibrant clients, making for a dynamic and engaging workplace.**



We are looking for aCorporate Day Security Officerto join our fantastic team based in London. You will work at a well-established estate service and investment firm who act with consideration for others' ideas and share information openly to inspire trust and encourage collaboration.



As a Security Officer you are an integral part of the team and you can make an impact with your skills to protect, deter and respond to any security matters, whilst providing an exceptional customer service experience.


**What do you get from us:**

  

* **The Role** – Full Time, 56 hours per week, 7 on 3 off, 7 on 4 off
* **Pay:** £13.42 per hour
* **Company Sick Pay**
* **Company Pension Scheme**
* **Life Assurance Scheme**
* Access to an **Online GP Service** for you and your dependents
* **Learning & Development** – we actively encourage progression and offer various eLearning courses, progression, training whilst on site, apprenticeships, and in-house training courses.
* **Health and Wellbeing** – access to mental health support specialists


**A typical day in the life as a Corporate Security Officer**


* Ensuring the building is safe and protected by carrying out both internal and external patrols, actively preventing any security concerns.
* Checking, and verifying entry passes, monitoring of alarm systems, access control and investigating any suspicious activity or behaviour.
* Interaction with customers, meeting and greeting both staff and visitors; listening to requests, taking an interest in what they have to say, show empathy, and be prepared to answer questions and follow up where you feel you might be able to help. It's about going that extra mile to show people we care.


**What are we looking for?**
  

We are looking for people who are passionate about helping others and keeping those around you both safe and secure.


* SIA Licence
* Experience in a security environment is beneficial but not essential, we are willing to put the time and resource into someone who may be recently licensed to give you the first step you might need.
* Hard work and excitement for your job, we love to see people enjoying their role
* A positive attitude with experience in a customer service role.


Apply today and secure your future with Wilson James!



Wilson James is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. A criminal conviction will not necessarily be a bar to obtaining a position, however each case will be assessed on an individual basis. For information about Wilson James' commitment to Equality, Diversity and Inclusion, https://wilsonjames.co.uk/sustainability

title: Night Chef
description:
Enrich the Journeys of our People and our Guests as our **Night Chef**!


The Landmark London looks for unique individuals to join a team full of energy and passion, where we value your strengths and growth potential. This could be your moment to become a part of our journey! We are located opposite Marylebone station and a short walk from Baker Street and Edgware Road stations.


Some of the **brilliant benefits** you will enjoy as a **Night Chef** are:

**Salary: £31,668 + service charge**

* Pension with company contributions
* 50% discount in all our restaurants and Spa treatments across our properties
* Team member and Friends & Family rates across our properties
* Complimentary stay after passing probation
* Extensive discounts on our benefits platform
* Access to private medical insurance
* Interest free season ticket loan
* Employee Assistance Programme - 24/7 online GP, mental health support and virtual wellbeing
* Support through development plans, apprenticeships and world-class management development programmes to be the best you can be
* Bike to work scheme
* Recommend a Friend incentive
* Uniforms provided and laundered complimentary
* Free meals on duty
* Opportunity to join our taskforces to contribute to the business focuses, community and environment
* Employee recognition schemes and Social Committee events including gala dinners and much more!

  

We are currently looking for a passionate **Night Chef**, to join our **Kitchen Team** on a **permanent** basis, with an immediate start to consistently deliver memorable moments and five star service to our guests and each other. It is important to us that everyone in the team brings positive energy to support our happy and fun environment, as we strive to build a community of diverse backgrounds and life experiences, where we care about careers and not just jobs.


As a **Night Chef**, your main duties and expectations for the role will include:

* To work as an individual and as part of a team by taking ownership for the correct preparation of mise-en-place and service for the section / department
* To prepare / cook food to the correct standard as specified in the recipe specification manual. Be aware of all menu changes and changes to dish specification.
* Understand the criteria set by AA and Leading Hotels of The World. Support senior chefs by ensuring that all food is cooked and presented to standards set in the outlet specification manual.
* Take full ownership for the kitchen for the duration of your shift, in the absence of the Senior Night Chef. Take appropriate action if problems arise, keeping the Night manager updated where appropriate
* Prepare a detailed written report for the Executive Chef / Sous chef following any incident or emergency situation, where possible, send via email with all Facts.
* To carry out all tasks as directed by your immediate supervisor/ manager and to assist in any other areas or duties within the kitchen/ hotel upon request

  

You will be required to work **40 hours** per week, on a shift rota.

 **We are …**

* #20 best company to work for in The Best Companies to Work For List 2023
* One of the best hotels in London
* A Leading Hotels of the World member
* 5 red stars
* 2 rosettes
* EarthCheck Bronze Certified 2024


If you feel your experience, personality and interest are a match for this **Night Chef** role, we encourage you to **apply** today. What makes you unique makes us exceptional!

***All applicants must be legally eligible to work in the UK***

title: Night Receptionist
description:
Night Receptionist – Job Spec

**What we offer**

As well as a competitive compensation package this role offers the following main benefits:

* Company pension
* 50% staff discount on food
* Great company culture with relaxed and collaborative working environment

**About us**

The Lime Tree Hotel is an independent boutique hotel located in the prestigious  
Belgravia area of London, adjacent to the charming artisan eateries and shops of  
Elizabeth Street. With 26 bedrooms our property is very popular with leisure travellers, who come to us for the great location, characterful building and our reputation for fantastic service. We were recently included in The Sunday Times  
‘Top 100 British Hotels’ list and CN Traveller’s ’10 Best Hotels in London’.

**The role**

We are looking for a friendly and reliable Night receptionist to work solo shifts between 10.00 pm and 07.00 am, two nights per week. Dependability, a cheerful disposition, a can-do attitude and good people skills are essential for this role. The main duties of this position include:

* Conducting routine security / safety checks
* Preparing night management reports / Cashiering.
* Ensuring guests are able to access the building promptly out of hours
* Dealing with late check-ins and early check-outs
* Assisting with any guest requirements arising, e.g. help carrying luggage, arranging taxi transfers, providing information on local facilities
* Completing basic reception administration functions
* Carrying out simple daily set-up tasks for the hotel restaurant
* Above all, ensuring the hotel is a safe and secure environment for guests and fellow team members.

**Who we’re looking for**

Some previous hotel reception experience is highly preferable, but not an absolute requirement. More importantly, we need someone with all of the following attributes:

* Able to support the hotel’s great reputation by providing excellent customer service at all times
* A great communicator with fluent English
* A mature, responsible individual with total integrity who is confident handling card and cash payments
* Experience with Opera PMS preferential.

If this role is of interest and you fulfil all the above criteria we would love to hear from you!

Please accept our apologies in advance that we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest.

title: Wait / Bar team members £13.50 ph (OTE £28,000.00)
description:
**This is a unique opportunity for an Experienced Bar & Floor Team member in a business that values people and is growing. Both full and part time roles available for both floor and bar staff in multifunctional roles with real training & development.** 

**If you are a positive, outgoing team player then we would love to meet you with a view to joining the team.**

**We are:**

An awarding winning group of independent venues in London. We are big on creating individual sites with unique experiences including our private dining spaces, cocktail bar, and stunning traditional pubs. We want our venues to be part of the community, we believe in local and we believe in becoming ever more sustainable.

Everyone in our team is part of our success and we share this with progression, rewards and the option to go on and have shares in your own venue.

We are looking for a bar & floor team members who aspire to progress.

**You are:**

**PASSIONATE, CURIOUS & FANATICAL**

We hope it goes without saying that everyone working in hospitality is hardworking, outgoing, punctual… all the obvious traits.

But for us we are looking for individuals who are ***PASSIONATE*** about our guest’s happiness and enjoyment; ***CURIOUS*** to always learn more and create something new; plus, ***FANATICAL*** about what we do, sustainable, British ingredients, recipes, and drinks.

We aren’t looking for someone to fit a mould, we want individuals bursting with character but who can also work in what is a brilliant team who always have each other’s backs.

When it comes to progressing and senior roles, we want role models and individuals who lead not manage. From founder to most recent recruit, we are all one team and involved in making the guest experience as close to perfect as possible.

**What’s good:**

* Full time position
* 50% discount on food in work & for you plus 3 guests visit ‘off duty’.
* Generous & fair tronc scheme, 100% goes to team.
* Real career opportunities, with the ability to own shares or run own business.
* Open proactive training including wines, food & cocktails.
* A sustainably minded business with ethics
* Staff events & incentives
* £300 team referral bonus
* Well-being and support partnership with LT Charity
* Nest Pension scheme

**And as you progress:**

* Real autonomy to make decisions and be involved in creative process.
* Real progression and financial incentives as you progress.
* Bar to Boardroom is a reality.
* Staff share / ownership options.
* External training and recognised qualifications

title: Customer Assistant
description:
Night Shift
  
Summary



£13.65 - £14.00 per hour | 30 hour contract | 10:00pm – 07:00am shifts | 30-35 days’ holiday (pro rata) | 10% in-store discount | Pension scheme


Everyone who works at Lidl brings something unique to the table - but we also have a whole lot in common. We’re collaborative, determined and we all pitch in to help each other out.


Just like you.


As a Lidl Customer Assistant, you’ll work together as a team to make sure we maintain our high standards day after day, night after night. From taking responsibility for the cleanliness of the store, to making sure it’s well-stocked for our customers. This isn’t just stacking shelves. This is feeding families. You’ll also reap the rewards of your hard work putting a shift in so that the store is ready before the doors even open.


In return, we’ll give you a competitive salary based on equal opportunity and pay structures, plus an extra £2.00 per hour for work during bank holidays and £3.50 per hour for night shifts, as well as a generous benefits package designed to support your well-being and life outside Lidl.


We’re proud to be a diverse, secure and fast-growing business, so we'll make sure you have quality training and real opportunities to build your career.


What you'll do


* Precisely unpack deliveries through the night during the week and weekends
* Make sure all access areas are clear for our drivers
* Keep the store spick and span – both on the shop floor and behind the scenes
* Help organise specific areas for promotions and special offers
* Independently carry out regular freshness checks and make sure our stock is fully rotated

What you'll need


* Knowledge or experience of working in a fast-paced environment
* Good attention to detail when working quickly
* The ability to react positively to changing priorities
* Self-motivation to work hard and do everything to the best of your ability
* The drive to work hard and contribute to the success of your store
* Ideally, previous experience working night shifts

What you'll receive


* 30-35 days' holiday (pro rata)
* 10% in-store discount
* Enhanced family leave
* Contributory pension scheme
* Long service awards
* Plus more of the perks you deserve

  

If you’re ready to get more out of your career and make a real difference, find your place at Lidl and apply now.


Please note your employment is conditional upon the Company's receipt of satisfactory references and if requested by the Company, a satisfactory Disclosure and Barring Service check.
company_description: We’re proud to have more than 960 stores and 14 regional distribution centres filled with 33,000 exceptional colleagues across Great Britain - and we're still growing.

title: Site Supervisor - Brighton
description:
**Purpose of Role:**

You will be responsible for upholding our company values of Self-Responsibility, Creative, Supportive and Respectful in all aspects of our day and to ensure the company is always represented in a professional and positive manner.

**Main Responsibilities:**

* To always supervise a safe, effective, and efficient site and operation, whilst ensuring the client and all visitors have an enjoyable experience whilst on site.
* Cover absences where needed.
* Full understanding and management of the weekly rota operations.
* Providing adequate training to site team and update staff records with SM.
* To assist the cleaning team to improving cleaning standards where needed.
* Ensure the site and the site's facilities are maintained to a high level of cleanliness and appearance to comply with the Company’s standards and the Health and Safety policy.
* Maintain effective and friendly working relationships with colleagues to promote a positive working environment.
* Ensure all team members comply with the Time and Attendance system.
* Check and report on cleaning equipment.
* Stoke check and order supplies with SM.
* Be prepared to undertake all reasonable tasks required to ensure consistent running of the site.
* Carry out daily checks and complete cleaning schedules.
* Report any issues - i.e. cleaning, access, and any maintenance issue to SM.
* Excellent understanding in COSHH and Risk Assessments
* Excellent understanding of (RAMS) Risk Assessment Method Statement

**Why Bayleaf Facilities Management?**

* You will be working as part of a great team where no 2 days are the same!
* We really like making sure our people are looked after and feel supported!
* We offer Wagestream - a financial wellbeing app giving you access to your money as you earn it!

Pay: £13.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Company pension
* Referral programme

Schedule:

* Night shift
* Weekend availability

Experience:

Language:

* basic english (preferred)

Work authorisation:

* United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: In person

title: Night Care Worker
description:
**Night Care Worker**

**Full-time, Part-time & Quantum Flexi (Casual) hours available**

At Quantum Care we are proud of our commitment to providing the highest quality care services for over 2000 older people in Hertfordshire, Bedfordshire and Essex. Our team ensure that all our residents will receive a tailored care adapted to their individual needs, they support them with daily living, including recreational activities, food and drink, administering medication, accessing health care and personal care. They offer support that directly impacts our residents’ wellbeing, assisting them to enjoy everyday life with dignity.

**Who we are looking for:**

* You’ll be naturally compassionate and patient, it is not necessary to have previous experience of working in a similar care environment because as long as you have a positive attitude and good communication skills, our first-class training will do the rest.
* You’ll be willing to undertake all aspects of care to meet the physical, emotional and social needs of our residents, training will be provided.
* A willingness to be trained and to achieve Level 2 Diploma in Health and Social Care
* The ability to work shifts (including weekends and evenings)
* You must be aged 18 or over to apply for this job

**We would love to have you in our team and in return we will provide the following rewards & benefits:**

* Competitive salaries with weekend enhancements
* Career development opportunities & recognition of career milestones
* First class in house training provided from day one
* Free Employee Assistant Programme: Providing 24/7 assistance to help balance work, family and life.
* Company Pension Scheme & optional salary death in service benefit (after 1 year)
* Free DBS and uniform
* Access to retail discounts and offers
* Refer a friend scheme of £500 per referral

**Terms and Conditions apply to all benefits**

This is a great opportunity to join a well-established organisation that offers a permanent job with great career progression. We welcome applications from people around the world who can work in the UK permanently or for a limited time. We need to make sure that our candidates have the right to work in the country as we’re not able to employ them otherwise. We are not able to offer sponsorship.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: £12.99-£13.97 per hour

Benefits:

* Company pension
* On-site parking
* Referral programme
* Store discount

Schedule:

* Night shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Bushey, WD23 2PY: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Licence/Certification:

* Level 2 diploma in Health and Social Care (preferred)

Work authorisation:

* United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: In person
company_description: At Quantum Care we aim to make a difference to the lives of older people and their family and friends. We provide residential, dementia and day care for a large number of older people from our purpose

title: Night Shift Warehouse Supervisor
description:
**Night Shift Warehouse Supervisor**

£Excellent salary (Please enquire) + Overtime + Excellent benefits

We have an excellent opportunity for a Warehouse Supervisor to join a world leading organisation supplying specialist equipment to the service industry

With significant growth over the last years, and strong presence all-over the globe, this company can offer excellent support, training and career prospects/progression opportunities to the right candidate.

Working hours: Night shift 10pm to 7am Mon-Fri

**Warehouse Supervisor’s Duties**

* Responsible for their warehouse operatives (within their warehouse department) and overall running of their department
* Ensuring that the set quality standards of equipment leaving their department is always achieved
* Ability to manage workload efficiently and meet strict deadlines whilst adhering to the priorities of the business.
* Manage returning stock effectively to ensure smooth flow of equipment around the department.
* Encourage an ethos of continual improvement and development of the department.

**Required Experience and Skills**

* Excellent hands-on experience working within a warehouse environment
* Team leading, supervision or management experience
* Able to work in a challenging and high pressured environment;
* Team player who is capable of management/leadership and will lead by example;
* Self-motivated, reliable, flexible and hard working;
* Proactive approach in all aspects of work, who contributes to challenging everyday processes and procedures to find more effective and efficient ways of improving the operation (Continuous Improvement);
* Clear, confident and precise communicator whether written or verbal;
* A keen eye for attention to detail
* P literate

To find out more about this opportunity, or about any other Warehouse Supervisor or Equipment Supervisor roles within Kadtech Recruitment, please apply

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

* Company pension
* Free parking
* Life insurance
* On-site parking
* Private medical insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

Reference ID: V0432

title: Night Shift Warehouse Technician
description:
**Night Shift Warehouse Technician**

**£Excellent basic salary (Please enquire) + overtime at enhanced rates + Excellent benefits (Pension, Healthcare, Holidays…etc)**

Location: Slough

We have an excellent opportunity for a Warehouse Technician to join a world leading supplier of equipment to the service industry. With significant growth over the last years, and strong presence all-over the globe, this company can offer excellent support, training and career prospects/opportunities to the right candidate.

Working with and learning on a wide spectrum of equipment, The Warehouse Technician will play a key part in this company's fast paced scaling and global growth.

Working hours: 10pm to 7am Mon-Fri

**As a Warehouse Technician, you will be responsible for:**

* Testing, checking and preparing a wide variety of equipment before they get despatched to customers.
* Storing returned equipment
* Warehouse duties including manual handling, loading and unloading

**Experience required for the Warehouse Technician**

* Previous experience in testing and/or checking equipment within a warehouse environment
* Physically fit and able to carry manual handling duties
* PAT testing experience or qualification would be an advantage, however, not essential

To apply, or to find out about any other Warehouse Technician or Equipment Technician roles with Kadtech Recruitment, please email your CV to us
